Facebook Bluesky TikTok Instagram Apple News Google News Orlando Weekly Open Search Search for: Search Support Us Menu News Open dropdown menu Abortion Rights Orlando Area News Florida News LGBTQ+ Pulse Views + Opinions Orlando Guides Digital Issue News Photos Arts + Culture Open dropdown menu Arts Stories + Interviews Things to Do Orlando Theme Parks Arts + Culture Photos Food + Drink Open dropdown menu Food News Drinking + Bars Restaurant Reviews Find a Restaurant Food + Drink Photos Music Open dropdown menu Music Stories + Interviews Orlando Music News Live Music Picks + Previews Find a Concert Music Photos Movies Open dropdown menu Movie Reviews Streaming Find a Theater Movie Times Cannabis Open dropdown menu Cannabis News Legislative Updates Dispensary Directory Calendar Open dropdown menu Today‚Äôs Events This Weekend Free Events Submit an Event Best Of Orlando¬Æ Open dropdown menu 2025 Voting Arts + Entertainment Attractions + Recreation City Life Drinking + Nightlife Food + Dining Health, Beauty + Wellness Local Music Local Notables Services Shopping + Retail Shop Best of Awards Orlando Photos Support Open dropdown menu Support Subscribe Advertise Instagram Twitter Facebook Posted in Food + Drink Ava MediterrAegean owners already thinking about more restaurants in Orlando by Alex Galbraith February 10, 2022 July 22, 2025 Share this: Click to email a link to a friend (Opens in new window) Email Click to share on Reddit (Opens in new window) Reddit Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Facebook Click to share on X (Opens in new window) X Click to share on Nextdoor (Opens in new window) Nextdoor Click to share on Bluesky (Opens in new window) Bluesky Ava MediterrAegean Credit: MILA Group The ownership group behind the just-opened Ava MediterrAegean restaurant in Winter Park are keen to expand. In an interview with Orlando Business Journal , co-owners Gregory and Marine Galy said they are in talks to open another restaurant in the area. The news comes less than a week after Ava opened in the longtime home of Winter Park fine-dining institution Luma on Park. ‚ÄúWe already are looking at opportunities,‚Äù Marine Galy said. ‚ÄúWe really love this market and we love the people out there.‚Äù Related Top Chef winner Hung Huynh won‚Äôt be in the kitchen when Ava MediterrAegean opens in Winter Park Ava was a long time coming, emerging in the midst of a messy fallout between the space‚Äôs former tenants and its owners. The Galys say they spent around $2.5 million renovating the space and dropped close to $5 million overall to get the restaurant open. ‚ÄúWhen you go after Luma, you have to do something great,‚Äù Marine Galy said of the space. The couple signed a 10-year lease on the building, clearly eyeing the sort of permanence Luma once had. With that eye toward the future, it makes sense that the Galys would be looking to expand their footprint in the Orlando area. ‚Äì Stay on top of Central Florida news and views with our weekly newsletters , and consider supporting this free publication . Our small but mighty team is working tirelessly to bring you Central Florida news, and every little bit helps. Related Stories Ava MediterrAegean sets opening date in February Top Chef winner Hung Huynh won‚Äôt be in the kitchen when Ava MediterrAegean opens in Winter Park Ava MediterrAegean promises notable chefs and a ‚Äòmultisensory‚Äô experience Ava MediterrAegean will bring an ‚Äòunderground mixology bar‚Äô to Winter Park Ava MediterrAegean, a high-end Mediterranean restaurant, will open in the old Luma on Park space in Winter Park Former Winter Park restaurant Luma on Park, landlords settle dueling lawsuits Luma on Park files lawsuit against former landlord seeking return to restaurant space, potentially millions in damages Upscale sports bar Parlay Orlando to take over old Finnhenry‚Äôs space downtown Vegan restaurant Plantees will take over former laundry space next to Will‚Äôs Pub in Mills 50 Bao‚Äôs Castle opens new ‚Äòghost kitchen‚Äô outpost at Collab Kitchens on Curry Ford This article appears in Feb 9-15, 2022 . Privacy Terms & Conditions Terms of Use Overview Spaces Press Nearby Hotels AVA Mediterraegean Restaurant 290 S Park Ave, Winter Park, FL 32789, USA AVA Mediterraegean 290 S Park Ave, Winter Park, FL 32789, USA Request Pricing Cuisine Type Mediterranean # of Spaces 8 Capacity Max Seated: 62 The multi-sensory venue features the true essence of Mediterranean and Aegean cultures, design, and cuisines combined to offer the most elevated dining experience in a meticulously curated and spirited atmosphere. The unique space pays homage to the simple spirit of Cycladic design. Embracing the effortless beauty of the Ô¨Åve elements, AVA MediterrAegean offers a unique experience that immerses all the senses through refined taste, bespoke mixology, transporting ethnic sounds, and an unparalleled ambiance. Ava MediterrAegean promises notable chefs and a 'multisensory' experience Close Search for: Search News Open dropdown menu Abortion Rights Orlando Area News Florida News LGBTQ+ Pulse Views + Opinions Orlando Guides Digital Issue News Photos Arts + Culture Open dropdown menu Arts Stories + Interviews Things to Do Orlando Theme Parks Arts + Culture Photos Food + Drink Open dropdown menu Food News Drinking + Bars Restaurant Reviews Find a Restaurant Food + Drink Photos Music Open dropdown menu Music Stories + Interviews Orlando Music News Live Music Picks + Previews Find a Concert Music Photos Movies Open dropdown menu Movie Reviews Streaming Find a Theater Movie Times Cannabis Open dropdown menu Cannabis News Legislative Updates Dispensary Directory Calendar Open dropdown menu Today‚Äôs Events This Weekend Free Events Submit an Event Best Of Orlando¬Æ Open dropdown menu 2025 Voting Arts + Entertainment Attractions + Recreation City Life Drinking + Nightlife Food + Dining Health, Beauty + Wellness Local Music Local Notables Services Shopping + Retail Shop Best of Awards Orlando Photos Support Open dropdown menu Support Subscribe Advertise Instagram Twitter Facebook Facebook Bluesky TikTok Instagram Apple News Google News Close Skip to content EARLY BIRD SALE TICKETS TO ORLANDO BEER FEST NOW AVAILABLE. Facebook Bluesky TikTok Instagram Apple News Google News Orlando Weekly Open Search Search for: Search Support Us Menu News Open dropdown menu Abortion Rights Orlando Area News Florida News LGBTQ+ Pulse Views + Opinions Orlando Guides Digital Issue News Photos Arts + Culture Open dropdown menu Arts Stories + Interviews Things to Do Orlando Theme Parks Arts + Culture Photos Food + Drink Open dropdown menu Food News Drinking + Bars Restaurant Reviews Find a Restaurant Food + Drink Photos Music Open dropdown menu Music Stories + Interviews Orlando Music News Live Music Picks + Previews Find a Concert Music Photos Movies Open dropdown menu Movie Reviews Streaming Find a Theater Movie Times Cannabis Open dropdown menu Cannabis News Legislative Updates Dispensary Directory Calendar Open dropdown menu Today‚Äôs Events This Weekend Free Events Submit an Event Best Of Orlando¬Æ Open dropdown menu 2025 Voting Arts + Entertainment Attractions + Recreation City Life Drinking + Nightlife Food + Dining Health, Beauty + Wellness Local Music Local Notables Services Shopping + Retail Shop Best of Awards Orlando Photos Support Open dropdown menu Support Subscribe Advertise Instagram Twitter Facebook Posted in Food + Drink Ava MediterrAegean promises notable chefs and a ‚Äòmultisensory‚Äô experience by Faiyaz Kara November 14, 2021 June 18, 2025 Share this: Click to email a link to a friend (Opens in new window) Email Click to share on Reddit (Opens in new window) Reddit Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Facebook Click to share on X (Opens in new window) X Click to share on Nextdoor (Opens in new window) Nextdoor Click to share on Bluesky (Opens in new window) Bluesky Ava MediterrAegean Credit: MILA Group If you‚Äôre the kind of person who enjoys the scents wafting inside posh hotel lobbies, then you‚Äôll love what Ava MediterrAegean ( Website | Instagram ) has in store when it opens in the old Luma space on Park Avenue early next year. A ‚Äúmultisensory experience‚Äù is what‚Äôs being promised ‚Äî everything from special ingredients, to Olya Volkova‚Äôs lush design (take a look at the slick renderings on this page), to, yes, signature scents that‚Äôll dazzle the olfactories. Members-only cocktail bar Credit: MILA Group Ava MediterrAegean‚Äôs secluded underground bar, called ‚ÄúThe Lounge,‚Äù will be situated in Luma‚Äôs old cellar/private dining space , and have its own unique aroma, moody atmo (yes, there will be a DJ), cocktail program (with bottle service, of course) and private dining areas. It‚Äôll be accessible through a secret entrance, though details on the members-only bar are still being hammered out. But taste will undoubtedly be Ava‚Äôs primary sensorial draw with Top Chef Season 3 winner Hung Huynh taking charge of the kitchen as executive chef. After snagging the TV title back in 2007, the talented, Vietnamese-born alum of Per Se and Guy Savoy spent four years with the EMM Restaurant Group before a well-publicized split . Hung bounced around after that and even did a stint at Morimoto Asia as chef de cuisine. In 2019, he opened Asian-fusion restaurant Warrior in L.A. but Huynh confirmed he is no longer associated with the West Hollywood hotspot. Ava MediterrAegean Credit: MILA Group When asked what makes his involvement with the MILA Group (the folks behind Ava and Mila MediterrAsian in Miami) different, Hung is quick to respond. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre dynamic and they‚Äôre young and I love that,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre willing to push the envelope, and not just from the culinary side.‚Äù ‚ÄúWe are taking a holistically creative approach,‚Äù says Marine Galy, MILA Group‚Äôs co-founder. ‚ÄúOur focus on the details, be it from the culinary side, the restaurant‚Äôs design, or the transportive mood we‚Äôre trying to instill has been very carefully curated. It will differentiate Ava from other restaurants in its class and we want to be the best in class.‚Äù Ava MediterrAegean Credit: MILA Group MILA Group‚Äôs culinary team includes corporate chef Daniel Garner (former executive chef at Nobu Beijing and Zuma New York/Miami) and R&D corporate chef Erick Melendez (former head chef at Zuma Las Vegas). Along with Hung, the chefs want to place the focus on quality ingredients. In fact, it took the trio a month to find the right tomato, but in addition to acquiring the finest local produce, the trio have forged relationships with local farms to supply poultry, lamb and seafood. They‚Äôll also procure specialty citrus from family-run outfit Bhumi Growers in New Jersey (yes, New Jersey). They‚Äôve supplied high-end restaurants in New York City including Michelin-starred Masa and Gabriel Kreuther . Executive chef Hung Huynh When the Michelin Guide and its foray into Florida enters the conversation, Hung remains pragmatic. ‚ÄúOf course, recognition from Michelin or the James Beard Foundation would be nice, but our focus in the kitchen is going to be on creativity and providing our customers with a superior experience.‚Äù So how does a chef known for his innovative pan-Asian fare shift focus to develop a menu of pan-Med cuisine ? ‚ÄúCooking is just like music,‚Äù Hung says. ‚ÄúThe tunes may be different, but the notes are the same.‚Äù ‚Äì Stay on top of Central Florida news and views with our weekly newsletters , and consider supporting this free publication . Our small but mighty team is working tirelessly to bring you Central Florida news, and every little bit helps. AVA MediterrAegean Announces Culinary Team, 2022 Opening ¬∑ the32789 September 11, 2025 Search the32789 News Business Food & Drink Community Arts Homes Health & Wellness Follow Us Winter Park, FL News Business Food & Drink Community Arts Homes Health & Wellness Search the32789 Earlier this week, AVA MediterrAegean announced plans to open its new restaurant concept at 290 South Park Ave. in early 2022 under various acclaimed chefs. Images Courtesy of: AVA MediterrAegean AVA MediterrAegean Announces Culinary Team, 2022 Opening By Abbie DeLozier | November 15, 2021 Earlier this week, AVA MediterrAegean announced plans to open its new restaurant concept at 290 South Park Ave. in early 2022 under various acclaimed chefs. Images Courtesy of: AVA MediterrAegean Share This: Coming soon to Winter Park, AVA MediterrAegean announced plans this week to open its new restaurant concept at 290 South Park Ave. in early 2022. The new restaurant will serve upscale Mediterranean cuisine and craft cocktails under the culinary leadership of Executive Chef Hung Huynh and acclaimed chefs Daniel Garner and Erick Melendez . In April, AVA MediterrAegean confirmed plans to move into the 11,000-square-foot Park Avenue corner space. Owned and operated by MILA Restaurant Group , the managing entity of Miami-based MediterrAsian restaurant MILA, AVA MediterrAegean will be the first to acquire the space formerly occupied by Luma on Park since its closing in September 2020. Chef Hung Huynh, also known as the ‚ÄúTop Chef,‚Äù was the season three winner of Bravo TV‚Äôs Emmy-winning cooking competition show and previously served as executive chef at CATCH NYC . According to Greg Galy, founder of the MILA Group, Chef Hung will lead the ‚Äúpowerhouse culinary team.‚Äù ‚ÄúAs executive chef at AVA MediterrAegean, Chef Hung‚Äôs international palate and background will allow him to create an innovative menu while staying true to the Cycladic traditions,‚Äù Galy said. ‚ÄúHe has traveled the world, cultivating his knowledge of different types of cuisine and will apply his innovative techniques and own signature twist at AVA MediterrAegean.‚Äù Renderings show a mix of contemporary and traditional design in AVA MediterrAegean, which MILA Restaurant Group aims to open in early 2022. Nobu Malibu Senior Sous Chef Daniel Garner, formerly served as head chef at Zuma , a restaurant known for its twist on the traditional Japanese Izakaya-style of informal eating and drinking, in New York and Miami. According to AVA, Garner will serve as MILA Restaurant Group‚Äôs corporate head chef, overseeing the executive culinary team at each restaurant to ensure consistency. ‚ÄúOur idea behind AVA MediterrAegean was to create a unique destination in Winter Park, offering a multi-sensory dining experience, where culinary excellence merges with an unparalleled transporting ambiance,‚Äù Galy said. ‚ÄúBringing an acclaimed team of chefs was non-negotiable to create this elevated journey and tap into a new culinary horizon for this market.‚Äù Chef Erick Melendez also comes from Zuma, and has worked in Zuma‚Äôs Miami, New York, London, and Rome locations. According to the MILA Restaurant Group, Chef Melendez will work as research & development corporate chef to introduce guests to ‚Äúunique flavor combinations‚Äù and ‚Äúmodern techniques.‚Äù According to MILA Restaurant Group Co-Founder Marine Galy, AVA MediterrAegean is designed to provide a ‚Äúhome away from home‚Äù for guests. Olya Volkova, founder and creative director at OV & Co., is the interior designer behind the new Park Avenue corner restaurant. According to MILA Restaurant Group Co-Founder Marine Galy, Volkova also designed AVA‚Äôs sister concept, MILA, a project that shortlisted her for a 2021 Restaurant & Design Award. The members-only Lounge is a secluded venue accessible through a secret entrance and will feature a DJ, custom VIP service, a mixology bar, premium bottle service, and two private dining rooms. For more information, visit AVA MediterrAegean on Instagram . Share This: Have a story idea?  Send us a note at news@the32789.com .  Follow our stories on Instagram , Twitter , and Facebook .
